name: Carbon180
question: What percentage of the United States' greenhouse gas emissions are removed by forests each year?
description: Carbon180 is on a mission to design and champion equitable, science-based policies that bring carbon removal solutions to gigaton scale.
fact: Did you know? A single mature tree can absorb up to 48 pounds of carbon dioxide per year, making forests one of nature's most powerful carbon removal tools.
achievement: 700+ appropriations requests prepared & submitted, which resulted in hundreds of millions being allotted for CO2 removal.

name: National Extension Association of Family and Consumer Sciences
question: What percentage of American households struggle with budgeting and financial planning, areas often addressed by family and consumer sciences programs?
description: The National Extension Association of Family and Consumer Sciences (NEAFCS) provides professional development for Extension educators who deliver programs that improve the lives of individuals, families, and communities.
fact: Did you know? NEAFCS programs cover topics from nutrition and food safety to financial literacy and family well-being, helping people make informed choices every day.
achievement: Supports thousands of educators who implement impactful programs nationwide.

description: The National Extension Association of Family and Consumer Sciences (NEAFCS) provides professional development for Extension educators who deliver programs that improve the lives of individuals, families, and communities.
fact: Did you know? NEAFCS programs cover topics from nutrition and food safety to financial literacy and family well-being, helping people make informed choices every day.

question: What percentage of American households struggle with budgeting and financial planning, areas often addressed by family and consumer sciences programs?
description: The National Extension Association of Family and Consumer Sciences (NEAFCS) provides professional development for Extension educators who deliver programs that improve the lives of individuals, families, and communities.
fact: Did you know? NEAFCS programs cover topics from nutrition and food safety to financial literacy and family well-being, helping people make informed choices every day.
achievement: Supports thousands of educators who implement impactful programs nationwide.

name: Village Partners International
question: What percentage of gifts does Village Partners International distribute directly to those in need?
description: Village Partners International is a volunteer-led nonprofit that partners, village to village, to deliver medical care, clean water, nutrition, and support for housing-insecure people in Uganda, Haiti, and Tampa, Florida—empowering communities to help themselves.
fact: Did you know? VPI holds a Charity Navigator four-star rating and the Candid Platinum Seal for transparency and accountability.
achievement: Supports pediatric, maternity, and mobile clinics and builds/maintains clean-water cisterns serving rural communities in Uganda and Haiti.

name: Genesis and Light Center
question: What percentage of at-risk youth who participate in structured afterschool programs show improvement in academic performance?
description: Genesis and Light Center empowers at-risk youth by promoting academic excellence, substance-free lifestyles, and providing them with opportunities to develop positive self-esteem and moral values.
fact: Did you know? Genesis and Light Center has been serving disadvantaged youth since 1992, focusing on creating positive environments that foster academic and personal growth.
achievement: Genesis and Light's afterschool services have impacted over 35,000 disadvantaged youth, and our summer programs have reached over 15,000. Our senior services have improved the lives of over 1,000 senior citizens.

name: Network Support Services Incorporated
question: What is the national average recidivism rate for individuals released from prison in the United States?
description: NSSI is a prison-based reentry program that bridges incarceration and community reintegration, providing therapeutic mentoring, life skills training, and wraparound support both behind the walls and after release to ensure individuals return home with the tools to succeed.
fact: Did you know? The national average recidivism rate is 67.5%, but NSSI maintains an exceptional 4% recidivism rate through their comprehensive support system.
achievement: We've transformed the reentry landscape by serving thousands of justice-impacted individuals—from those currently incarcerated to those diverted from the system entirely—through a continuum of care that begins inside prison walls and extends deep into the community.

name: All Hands and Hearts
question: Which earthquake had the largest faultline rupture of all time?
description: All Hands and Hearts provides community-inspired, volunteer-powered disaster relief.
fact: Did you know? The 2004 Indian Ocean Earthquake affected 14 countries and caused over 230,000 deaths, making it one of the deadliest natural disasters in recorded history.
achievement: Impacted over 1.5 million people in 29 countries with volunteer-powered disaster relief programs.

name: Healthy Kids, Happy Planet!
question: What do scientists say is the single biggest way to reduce your impact on Earth?
options: Putting solar panels on your roof
description: Healthy Kids, Happy Planet! is on a mission to empower students through eco-focused, plant-forward nutrition education—our vision is a world where youth thrive in a culture of health, environmental stewardship, and ethical food systems.
fact: Did you know? Reducing meat and dairy consumption is one of the most impactful ways individuals can reduce their environmental footprint, according to numerous scientific studies.
achievement: We were honored to receive the 2024 Harkin on Wellness Award, recognizing our work as one of the best programs in the country working to improve the well-being of students and young people.

name: Interstitial Cystitis Association
question: Who gets interstitial cystitis/bladder pain syndrome?
options: Only older adults, over the age of 65 years
Anyone of any age, race, or sex
description: The mission of the Interstitial Cystitis Association is to ensure efficient diagnosis and optimal care for people affected by interstitial cystitis/bladder pain syndrome through advocacy, education, and community.
fact: Did you know? The human bladder can stretch to hold about 2 cups of liquid, but when healthy, it typically signals the need to empty when it's only about 1/4 full.
achievement: Created ICA IC/BPS Support Group, a safe space for sharing experiences and offering support, which has over 6,100 members

name: MOASH
question: Which of the following U.S. states received the lowest grade for its sex education policies, according to SIECUS?
description: MOASH works alongside youth to ensure that young people in Michigan have access to sexual health services and sexual health education.
fact: Did you know? Michigan is home to over 2.2 million young people under 18, making it one of the states with the highest youth populations in the Midwest.
achievement: Vital to the passing of Proposal 3,the Right to Reproductive Freedom Initiative.

name: Accessible Hope International
question: What percentage of the world's population has a disability?
description: Accessible Hope International is a missions organization committed to creating a hope-filled future for people with disabilities—empowering them to thrive as full and valued members of their communities, free from stigma and barriers.
fact: Did you know? The first wheelchair was invented in 1595 for King Philip II of Spain, making it one of the oldest assistive technologies still in use today.
achievement: 29 Countries reached through Theology of Disability workshops.

name: International Clarinet Association
question: Who is credited with inventing the clarinet?
description: The International Clarinet Association is a diverse and inclusive community of clarinetists and clarinet enthusiasts that supports projects that will benefit clarinet performance.
fact: Did you know? Incredible Dynamics: The clarinet is known for its ability to fade in and out of a note and for its "wild dynamics," easily moving from very soft to very loud.
achievement: We have an instrument donation program that has refurbished and rehomed over 100 instruments.

name: Shoes 4 Africa
question: What percentage of Kenya's population lives below the international poverty line of $2.15 per day?
description: Shoes 4 Africa - Advancing Africa: Building Hospitals, Healthcare, Education, and Empowerment
fact: Did you know? Africa is home to the world's largest hot desert (Sahara) and the world's longest river (Nile), making it a continent of incredible natural diversity.
achievement: Built East & Central Africa's first public children's hospital that has treated over 1.3 million children.

name: National Alliance for Children's Grief
question: 1 in how many children will be bereaved (grieve the loss of a sibling or parent) by the age of 18?
description: The National Alliance for Children's Grief (NACG) is a nonprofit organization that raises awareness about the needs of children and teens who are grieving a death and provides education and resources for anyone who supports them.
fact: Did you know? Children often express grief differently than adults - they may play, draw, or act out their feelings rather than talking about them directly.
achievement: Provided over 10900+ hours of quality education to childhood bereavement professionals this year.

name: National Headache Foundation
question: About how many people in the United States live with migraine?
description: The National Headache Foundation works to create a future where everyone living with headache can thrive in optimal, functional, and connected lives through education, awareness, research, and advocacy.
fact: Did you know? The word 'migraine' comes from the Greek word 'hemikrania,' which means 'half skull,' referring to the typical one-sided headache that many migraine sufferers experience.
achievement: Makes the latest comprehensive information on headache disorders and migraine disease freely available to everyone.

name: Random Acts
question: What phrase became popular in the 1980s–1990s to describe doing good deeds for others without expecting anything in return?
description: Random Acts inspires people of all backgrounds to perform acts of kindness, providing funding and support for projects that improve communities around the world.
fact: Did you know? The idea of kindness spreading through chains of good deeds was also popularized by the book and movie Pay It Forward.
achievement: Has sponsored over 1,000 acts of kindness worldwide since its inception.
